item.title: Replace the default shell for domain users on Linux
item.description: Intro After setting up the AD trust, every time I logged in the shell defaulted to /bin/sh. To change it to /bin/bash or any other shell of your choice you can do the following. Editing SSSD.conf Navigate to /etc/sssd/ and open sssd.conf in an elevated text editor. It should look something like [domain/lin.mydomain.com] ... use_fully_qualified_names = false [domain/lin.mydomain.com/win.mydomain.com] use_fully_qualified_names = false [sssd] ...
